tool.name: AddAreaEvaluatorToSN
tool.displayname: Add Area Evaluator to Spatial Notification
tool.summary: This GP tool adds a new area evaluator to an existing spatial notification. Please refer to the Workflow Manager user's guide for further details on both spatial notifications and area evaluators.

param.name: in_string_spatialNotification
param.dialogReference:
The name of the spatial notification to which the area evaluator will be added.

The domain for this parameter is created dynamically based on the contents of the Workflow Manager database.
param.pythonReference:
The name of the spatial notification to which the area evaluator will be added.

The domain for this parameter is created dynamically based on the contents of the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_string_geometricOperation
param.dialogReference:
The geometric operation used by the area evaluator. The following relationship governs how the area evaluator will work:

<notifier AOI> <geometric operation> <feature>

So for instance, suppose that "notifier AOI" was a polygon representing the United States, and "geometric operation" was "CONTAINS". The area evaluator would evaluate to true for any feature that is contained by the U.S. polygon.

The following values are available as options (please see the ArcGIS Desktop user's guide for further information):

  • CONTAINS

  • CROSSES

  • ENVELOPE_INTERSECTS

  • INTERSECTS

  • OVERLAPS

  • TOUCHES

  • WITHIN
param.pythonReference:
The geometric operation used by the area evaluator. The following relationship governs how the area evaluator will work:

<notifier AOI> <geometric operation> <feature>

So for instance, suppose that "notifier AOI" was a polygon representing the United States, and "geometric operation" was "CONTAINS". The area evaluator would evaluate to true for any feature that is contained by the U.S. polygon.

The following values are available as options (please see the ArcGIS Desktop user's guide for further information):

  • CONTAINS

  • CROSSES

  • ENVELOPE_INTERSECTS

  • INTERSECTS

  • OVERLAPS

  • TOUCHES

  • WITHIN

param.name: in_bool_useInverse
param.displayname: Use the inverse of the geometric operation above (ex: notifier AOI does not <xxx> feature)
param.dialogReference: This flag indicates whether the inverse of the geometric operation named above should be used. See the help for the "geometric operation" parameter for more detals.
param.pythonReference: This flag indicates whether the inverse of the geometric operation named above should be used. See the help for the "geometric operation" parameter for more detals.

param.name: in_bool_useJobAoi
param.displayname: Use the AOI of the job being worked as the notifier AOI
param.dialogReference:
This parameter indicates that the job AOI should be used as the area against which to check feature changes.

In a script, the following options are available:

  • USE_JOB_AOI / true - Sets the area evaluator to use the individual job AOIs as test areas

  • USE_SELECTED_FEATURE / false - Sets the area evaluator to use a specific feature as its test AOI (...to be specified in the next parameter)
param.pythonReference:
This parameter indicates that the job AOI should be used as the area against which to check feature changes.

In a script, the following options are available:

  • USE_JOB_AOI / true - Sets the area evaluator to use the individual job AOIs as test areas

  • USE_SELECTED_FEATURE / false - Sets the area evaluator to use a specific feature as its test AOI (...to be specified in the next parameter)

param.name: in_layer_alternateAoi
param.displayname: Area of Interest (polygon layer with exactly one selected feature)
param.dialogReference:
This argument allows a feature layer with a single selected feature to be passed in. The boundary of this selected feature will be used as the test AOI for the area evaluator.

Since this argument requires a layer with a selected feature, it is best used as part of a GP script or model. (See the "Documentation" folder for some examples.)

This parameter is only enabled if the "use job AOI" parameter is set to "false".
param.pythonReference:
This argument allows a feature layer with a single selected feature to be passed in. The boundary of this selected feature will be used as the test AOI for the area evaluator.

Since this argument requires a layer with a selected feature, it is best used as part of a GP script or model. (See the "Documentation" folder for some examples.)

This parameter is only enabled if the "use job AOI" parameter is set to "false".

param.name: in_string_wmxDatabaseAlias
param.dialogReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.
param.pythonReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.

tool.usage:
• The default Workflow Manager database must be set before running this tool.

  • The user running this tool must have administrative access to the Workflow Manager database.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This GP tool adds a new area evaluator to an existing spatial notification. Please refer to the Workflow Manager user's guide for further details on both spatial notifications and area evaluators.

idCitation.resTitle: Add Area Evaluator to Spatial Notification
